title: STUDY THEME.  The Humanity of Jesus. Part 3
devotional:
The story of the Birth of Jesus is not only about how He began His life on earth, but it contains an important principle that should mark all our lives.

God wants us to live in the real world, as it is, not as we think it should be. This will require great vulnerability and often we will feel out of our depth and misunderstood. The vulnerability of Jesus caused great suspicion but it also drew people like the shepherds to him.

The steps Jesus took to become human are the same steps we all need to take in order to become more human. The manner, in which Jesus embraced his humanity, is how he redefined our humanity.

He refused to hold onto his privileges as God, but rather he made himself of ‘no reputation.’ Humility and the refusal to be self-seeking are totally consistent with how God originally intended mankind to live. Condescension, as we shall see is an expression of being secure in the real knowledge of the love of God.

Although Jesus refused to hold onto his privileges and position as God, he never ceased to be God, although He never depended on his Divinity to cope with the pressures and demands of his humanity.

The implications of having this mindset are enormous.

Every time we feel a need to hold onto a position of power, or every time we feel a need to be seen to be in control in order to feel secure and fulfilled, we are violating the attitudes that brought Jesus to earth and to the cross. Jesus did not feel the need to hold on to his position, power, or prestige. He did not get his security from being in a place of prominence or authority, but from his submission to his father. Security through submission is the way to go.
prayer: Prayer. Father help me embrace my humanity by letting go of prestige power and position.
